rename.from: Reflect font size config change dynamically

body:
This would presumably override the current font size set by the user of a running terminal (set using the `*FontSize` actions). This seems fine to me, but if people are trying to use the live config feature to update visuals on the fly, I wouldn't want my font sizes resetting.

Generally live updating configurations that can be changed at runtime seems hard. How do we handle this with any other configs today? How can we be consistent about this?

> This would presumably override the current font size set by the user of a running terminal (set using the *FontSize actions). This seems fine to me, but if people are trying to use the live config feature to update visuals on the fly, I wouldn't want my font sizes resetting.

We should be able to just compare if the current font size is equal to the original font size and reset it only if that is the case.

> Generally live updating configurations that can be changed at runtime seems hard. How do we handle this with any other configs today?

I don't think any other option where this is possible comes to mind.
Has anyone begun working on this? It's kind of a personal itch that I'd like to scratch and I am looking for a good [hacktoberfest](https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com/details) challenge.

@waynr As far as I know, nobody is working on this right now and it would be a very welcome addition.

If you have any questions about how to approach this, please let me know.

These are some of the relevant places for this issue:
 - [This is the config update handler closest to where our font is cached](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/blob/master/alacritty_terminal/src/display.rs#L129-L131)
 - [Our font cache is created here](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/blob/master/alacritty_terminal/src/display.rs#L308-L309)

As far as I can tell, the following steps should be taken:
 - Check if font has changed
 - Evict existing glyph cache
 - Fill new glyph cache
 - Update our cell metrics

This is of course just necessary if we want to go all the way and enable live reloading for the font. If we just want to live update the default font size, things get much easier.

The font size update code can just be handled in the [terminal's config update handler](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/blob/master/alacritty_terminal/src/term/mod.rs#L926-L941) and we'd just need to check if the current font size is equal to the old default font size and if that's the case we can change it to the new font size.

Since these two issues are so different in complexity, it probably makes sense to split them if someone is interested in going for the font size change. So handling them in separate PRs is no problem. If someone is doing the style reloading anyways, the size change shouldn't be much more complicated though.

@chrisduerr thanks for the excellent guidance! I am stuck in an airport so I'm gonna start looking into this now but not sure when I'll have any PRs up.

I'll probably do as you suggest and make the default font size change in a separate PR to start with since it sounds like a good way to get started.

issue.title: Live reload font size from alacritty config
issue.body: Addresses first part of \#2737. Second part, which will be font family and styles to also be live-reloaded, is coming in a follow-up PR.

issue.title: Live reload font family and style from alacritty config
issue.body:
Follow-up to \#2834, addresses second part of \#2737.

This seems to work for me as a naive first pass, but I kind of just blindly copied what looked to be the relevent parts of `Display.new` where the initial `GlyphCache` is populated.

One notable difference is that I left out the logic around estimated DPR since at this point we already have a known `Display.size_info.dpr` calculated when `Display::new` is run.
